title: Unicorn or horse
data:
The **unicorn or horse** is a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, and is represented by the lowercase [u](/wiki/U "U") glyph (u). Unicorns and horses are designated internally by the macro **S\_UNICORN**.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The class contains the following monsters:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- u [pony](/wiki/Pony "Pony")
- u [white unicorn](/wiki/White_unicorn "White unicorn")
- u [gray unicorn](/wiki/Gray_unicorn "Gray unicorn")
- u [black unicorn](/wiki/Black_unicorn "Black unicorn")
- u [horse](/wiki/Horse "Horse")
- u [warhorse](/wiki/Warhorse "Warhorse")

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Common traits](#Common_traits)
  - [1.1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Messages](#Messages)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [4.3 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [4.4 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.5 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [4.6 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [4.7 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.8 GnollHack](#GnollHack)
  - [4.9 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [4.10 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Common traits

Unicorns and horses are [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") and [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivorous "Herbivorous") equine monsters that have a tendency to wander while moving, and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). The domestic horses are all [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") [animals](/wiki/Animal "Animal"), while [unicorns](/wiki/Unicorn "Unicorn") are [intelligent monsters](/wiki/Intelligent_monster "Intelligent monster") and there is one for each alignment. Unicorns and horses generally have high movement [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed") and attack using [kicks](/wiki/Kick "Kick").

### Generation

The domestic horses may generate as peaceful for neutral characters; unicorns generate as peaceful towards characters of their alignment, and will otherwise be hostile.

## History

The unicorn first appears in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0") as an [individual monster](/index.php?title=Unicorn_\(monster\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Unicorn (monster) (page does not exist)"), and is phased out in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), which establishes the monster class and the aligned unicorns. The domestic horses are added to the monster class in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Messages

- The \<unicorn/horse> whickers.

  You were [chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting") to a tame unicorn or horse.

- The \<unicorn/horse> whinnies.

  As above, but they are also hungry.

- The \<unicorn/horse> neighs.

  As above while they are low on tameness, or else are not tame.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") adds two new monsters to the monster class:

- u [Pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus "Pegasus")
- u [Nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Nightmare (SLASH'EM)")

### GruntHack

[GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack") adds one new monster to the monster class:

- u [Nightmare](/index.php?title=Nightmare_\(GruntHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nightmare (GruntHack) (page does not exist)")

### SporkHack

[SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack") adds one new monster to the monster class:

- u [nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(SporkHack\) "Nightmare (SporkHack)")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds one new monster to the monster class:

- u [nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(dNetHack\) "Nightmare (dNetHack)")

[Dreprun](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Dreprun "User:Chris/dNetHack/Dreprun") is a [stave](/wiki/Stave "Stave") that can ward against unicorns and horses.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds some new monsters to the monster class:

- u [selkie](/index.php?title=Selkie_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Selkie (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")
- u [nightmare](/index.php?title=Nightmare_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nightmare (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")
- u [pale horse](/index.php?title=Pale_horse_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pale horse (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")
- u [white horse](/index.php?title=White_horse_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "White horse (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")
- u [black horse](/index.php?title=Black_horse_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Black horse (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")

### notdNetHack

[notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") retains the monster added in dNetHack and adds another new monster to the class:

- u [Lokoban Pinata](/wiki/Lokoban_Pinata "Lokoban Pinata")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds many new monsters to the monster class:

- u [lesser nightmare](/wiki/Lesser_nightmare "Lesser nightmare")
- u [nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(EvilHack\) "Nightmare (EvilHack)")
- u [cauchemar](/wiki/Cauchemar "Cauchemar")
- u [pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus_\(EvilHack\) "Pegasus (EvilHack)")
- u [greater pegasus](/wiki/Greater_pegasus "Greater pegasus")
- u [Pale Horse](/index.php?title=Pale_Horse_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pale Horse (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
- u [White Horse](/index.php?title=White_Horse_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "White Horse (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
- u [Black Horse](/index.php?title=Black_Horse_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Black Horse (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")
- u [Red Horse](/index.php?title=Red_Horse\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Red Horse (page does not exist)")

The unicorn or horse is the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Infidels](/wiki/Infidel "Infidel"), and makes up 6⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Infidel quest](/wiki/Infidel_quest "Infidel quest"). Random unicorns and horse are also generated on some levels of the quest branch, with two generated on the locate level, four generated on the lower filler level(s), and three generated on the goal level.

### GnollHack

[GnollHack](/wiki/GnollHack "GnollHack") adds some new monsters to the monster class:

- u [ram](/index.php?title=Ram\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ram (page does not exist)")
- u [pegasus](/index.php?title=Pegasus_\(GnollHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pegasus (GnollHack) (page does not exist)")
- u [large ram](/index.php?title=Large_ram\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Large ram (page does not exist)")
- u [war ram](/index.php?title=War_ram\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "War ram (page does not exist)")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds another new monster to the class:

- u [young unicorn](/index.php?title=Young_unicorn\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Young unicorn (page does not exist)")

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds many new monsters to the monster class from other variants:

- u [lesser nightmare](/wiki/Lesser_nightmare "Lesser nightmare")
- u [greater nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(EvilHack\) "Nightmare (EvilHack)")
- u [cauchemar](/wiki/Cauchemar "Cauchemar")
- u [selkie](/index.php?title=Selkie_\(SpliceHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Selkie (SpliceHack) (page does not exist)")
- u [pegasus](/wiki/Pegasus_\(EvilHack\) "Pegasus (EvilHack)")
- u [greater pegasus](/wiki/Greater_pegasus "Greater pegasus")
- u [Nightmare](/wiki/Nightmare_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Nightmare (SLASH'EM)")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 35](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monsym.h#L35)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 819](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/monst.c#L819)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Unicorn or horse

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The unicorn or horse is a monster class that appears in NetHack, and is represented by the lowercase u glyph (u). Unicorns and horses are designated internally by the macro S_UNICORN.[1]

The class contains the following monsters:[2]

  • u pony
  • u white unicorn
  • u gray unicorn
  • u black unicorn
  • u horse
  • u warhorse

Contents

  • 1 Common traits
    • 1.1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Messages
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 GruntHack
    • 4.3 SporkHack
    • 4.4 dNetHack
    • 4.5 SpliceHack
    • 4.6 notdNetHack
    • 4.7 EvilHack
    • 4.8 GnollHack
    • 4.9 SlashTHEM
    • 4.10 Hack'EM
  • 5 References

Common traits

Unicorns and horses are strong and herbivorous equine monsters that have a tendency to wander while moving, and can be seen via infravision. The domestic horses are all neutral animals, while unicorns are intelligent monsters and there is one for each alignment. Unicorns and horses generally have high movement speed and attack using kicks.

Generation

The domestic horses may generate as peaceful for neutral characters; unicorns generate as peaceful towards characters of their alignment, and will otherwise be hostile.

History

The unicorn first appears in Hack 1.0 as an individual monster, and is phased out in NetHack 3.0.0, which establishes the monster class and the aligned unicorns. The domestic horses are added to the monster class in NetHack 3.3.0.

Messages

The <unicorn/horse> whickers.
You were chatting to a tame unicorn or horse.
The <unicorn/horse> whinnies.
As above, but they are also hungry.
The <unicorn/horse> neighs.
As above while they are low on tameness, or else are not tame.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM adds two new monsters to the monster class:

  • u Pegasus
  • u Nightmare

GruntHack

GruntHack adds one new monster to the monster class:

  • u Nightmare

SporkHack

SporkHack adds one new monster to the monster class:

  • u nightmare

dNetHack

dNetHack adds one new monster to the monster class:

  • u nightmare

Dreprun is a stave that can ward against unicorns and horses.

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds some new monsters to the monster class:

  • u selkie
  • u nightmare
  • u pale horse
  • u white horse
  • u black horse

notdNetHack

notdNetHack retains the monster added in dNetHack and adds another new monster to the class:

  • u Lokoban Pinata

EvilHack

EvilHack adds many new monsters to the monster class:

  • u lesser nightmare
  • u nightmare
  • u cauchemar
  • u pegasus
  • u greater pegasus
  • u Pale Horse
  • u White Horse
  • u Black Horse
  • u Red Horse

The unicorn or horse is the second quest monster class for Infidels, and makes up 6⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Infidel quest. Random unicorns and horse are also generated on some levels of the quest branch, with two generated on the locate level, four generated on the lower filler level(s), and three generated on the goal level.

GnollHack

GnollHack adds some new monsters to the monster class:

  • u ram
  • u pegasus
  • u large ram
  • u war ram

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds another new monster to the class:

  • u young unicorn

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds many new monsters to the monster class from other variants:

  • u lesser nightmare
  • u greater nightmare
  • u cauchemar
  • u selkie
  • u pegasus
  • u greater pegasus
  • u Nightmare

References

  1. ↑ include/monsym.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 35
  2. ↑ src/monst.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 819

rawPage:
The '''unicorn or horse''' is a [[monster class]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]'', and is represented by the lowercase [[u]] glyph ({{white|u}}). Unicorns and horses are designated internally by the macro '''S_UNICORN'''.{{refsrc|include/monsym.h|35|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

The class contains the following monsters:{{refsrc|src/monst.c|819|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

* {{monsymlink|pony}}
* {{monsymlink|white unicorn}}
* {{monsymlink|gray unicorn}}
* {{monsymlink|black unicorn}}
* {{monsymlink|horse}}
* {{monsymlink|warhorse}}

==Common traits==
Unicorns and horses are [[strong]] and [[herbivorous]] equine monsters that have a tendency to wander while moving, and can be seen via [[infravision]]. The domestic horses are all [[neutral]] [[animal]]s, while [[unicorn]]s are [[intelligent monster]]s and there is one for each alignment. Unicorns and horses generally have high movement [[speed]] and attack using [[kick]]s.

===Generation===
The domestic horses may generate as peaceful for neutral characters; unicorns generate as peaceful towards characters of their alignment, and will otherwise be hostile.

==History==
The unicorn first appears in [[Hack 1.0]] as an [[Unicorn (monster)|individual monster]], and is phased out in [[NetHack 3.0.0]], which establishes the monster class and the aligned unicorns. The domestic horses are added to the monster class in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

==Messages==
{{message|The <unicorn/horse> whickers.|You were [[chatting]] to a tame unicorn or horse.}}
{{message|The <unicorn/horse> whinnies.|As above, but they are also hungry.}}
{{message|The <unicorn/horse> neighs.|As above while they are low on tameness, or else are not tame.}}

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] adds two new monsters to the monster class:

* {{monsymlink|Pegasus}}
* {{monsymlink|Nightmare|variant=SLASH'EM}}

===GruntHack===
[[GruntHack]] adds one new monster to the monster class:

* {{monsymlink|Nightmare|variant=GruntHack}}

===SporkHack===
[[SporkHack]] adds one new monster to the monster class:

* {{green|u}} [[Nightmare (SporkHack)|nightmare]]

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] adds one new monster to the monster class:

* {{orange|u}} [[Nightmare (dNetHack)|nightmare]]

[[User:Chris/dNetHack/Dreprun|Dreprun]] is a [[stave]] that can ward against unicorns and horses.

===SpliceHack===
[[SpliceHack]] adds some new monsters to the monster class:

* {{green|u}} [[Selkie (SpliceHack)|selkie]]
* {{red|u}} [[Nightmare (SpliceHack)|nightmare]]
* {{gray|u}} [[Pale horse (SpliceHack)|pale horse]]
* {{gray|u}} [[White horse (SpliceHack)|white horse]]
* {{gray|u}} [[Black horse (SpliceHack)|black horse]]

===notdNetHack===
[[notdNetHack]] retains the monster added in dNetHack and adds another new monster to the class:

* {{cyan|u}} [[Lokoban Pinata]]

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] adds many new monsters to the monster class:

* {{green|u}} [[lesser nightmare]]
* {{green|u}} [[Nightmare (EvilHack)|nightmare]]
* {{green|u}} [[cauchemar]]
* {{white|u}} [[Pegasus (EvilHack)|pegasus]]
* {{white|u}} [[greater pegasus]]
* {{gray|u}} [[Pale Horse (EvilHack)|Pale Horse]]
* {{gray|u}} [[White Horse (EvilHack)|White Horse]]
* {{gray|u}} [[Black Horse (EvilHack)|Black Horse]]
* {{red|u}} [[Red Horse]]

The unicorn or horse is the second [[quest]] monster class for [[Infidel]]s, and makes up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Infidel quest]]. Random unicorns and horse are also generated on some levels of the quest branch, with two generated on the locate level, four generated on the lower filler level(s), and three generated on the goal level.

===GnollHack===
[[GnollHack]] adds some new monsters to the monster class:

* {{red|u}} [[ram]]
* {{brightblue|u}} [[Pegasus (GnollHack)|pegasus]]
* {{red|u}} [[large ram]]
* {{red|u}} [[war ram]]

===SlashTHEM===
[[SlashTHEM]] retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and adds another new monster to the class:

* {{gray|u}} [[young unicorn]]

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] adds many new monsters to the monster class from other variants:

* {{green|u}} [[lesser nightmare]]
* {{green|u}} [[Nightmare (EvilHack)|greater nightmare]]
* {{green|u}} [[cauchemar]]
* {{green|u}} [[Selkie (SpliceHack)|selkie]]
* {{white|u}} [[Pegasus (EvilHack)|pegasus]]
* {{white|u}} [[greater pegasus]]
* {{monsymlink|Nightmare|variant=SLASH'EM}}

==References==
